answers.answer: Ive been on official bedrest because my dr doesnt like my bp but its not preeclampsia...they seem to be very precautious these days..ive bern on it since 34 & will be the rest of my pregnancy

Yeah I have my next appointment this Thursday and I will be 34 weeks. And I mean I don't really mind being on bed rest cause I'm in so much pain down there it hurts to move but I just never heard of them starting the weekly appointments so early unless there was a problem but I guess it's better safe than sorry. Can't wait till my little man gets here.
I think it's a better safe than sorry kind of thing. He probably just wants to be cautious.

I'm not in bed rest, but I'm 33 weeks and have been put to every week appointment, n ultrasounds have been made every two weeks because baby is measuring 2 weeks behind. Anyways, what does BP stands for?
Yeah that's what I'm thinking as well Canadiana. And BP stands for blood pressure.

question: Ok so earlier last week I posted that I was having major pains in my vajayjay that it hurt to make any kind of movement and some pressure down there. Well I went to the Dr on Thursday and was 33weeks exactly. I told him what was going on and they tested my urine and everything and it came back no infections and he checked my cervix and said it was thick and closed and that it was just from being pregnant. The bottom number for my BP was a little higher than they liked but it's not preeclampsia so that's good. But my Dr did put me on unofficial bed rest and started my appointments every week from now on out until waiting till I'm 36 weeks. I mean I'm ok with that but I had never heard of them doing that unless there was something wrong. Any thoughts ladies?
title: Update on post from last week
